page.title: 04MIDDLE RASEN-PRESENT DAY
page.content: The modern village of Middle Rasen has been eclipsed by its neighbour to the east Market Rasen. In recent years new properties have been built and there is now a fair cross-section of society in the village.Newcomer Professionals and locals alike try to create a village spirit. There is still the village Primary School with 90 pupils who transfer to De Aston Comprehensive School at 11. There is no industry in the village, most of the population travel to either Lincoln,Grimsby or to Market Rasen to work. There is now a tendency for people to retire to what has become a 'dormitory' village. Whilst retaining the usual village amenities and organisations(W.I. etc.), its church and Methodist Chapel,the village relies quite heavily on Market Rasen.
